front.title: 5QI to DiffServ DSCP Mapping Example for Enforcement of 5G End-to-End Network Slice QoS

abstract.t: 5G End-to-End Network Slice QoS is an essential aspect of network slicing, as described in both IETF drafts and the ETSI specification. Network slicing allows for the creation of multiple logical networks on top of a shared physical infrastructure, tailored to support specific use cases or services. The primary goal of QoS in network slicing is to ensure that the specific performance requirements of each slice are met, including latency, reliability, and throughput.
